intro: Diplopeltis huegelii subsp. huegelii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Urticaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, opposite leaves and small greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, elongated, spiky fruit that contains numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
